tokens.tooltip: Focuses tightly on the subject, showing detail and emotion.
Shows the subject from the waist up, providing context.
Shows the subject in relation to their surroundings, emphasizing environment.
A view of a figure in its entirety
Positions the camera at the same height as the subject's eyes, creating a neutral perspective.
Positions the camera above the subject, making them appear smaller or weaker.
Positions the camera below the subject, making them appear larger or more powerful.
Places the subject in the exact middle of the frame, emphasizing balance and stability.
Divides the frame into thirds, placing key elements along these lines or intersections for visual interest.
Keeps the camera stationary, focusing on the subject without any movement.
Horizontally rotates the camera on a fixed axis, following a moving subject or revealing a wide scene.
Vertically rotates the camera on a fixed axis, scanning up or down a subject or scene.
Provides a natural perspective, similar to human vision.
Places the subject in the foreground, making them the primary focus of the image.
Places the subject in the background, emphasizing their relationship to the environment.
